purpose: Defines reusable Alert UI components with customizable variants for displaying notifications or important messages in a React application

variables.name: alertVariants
variables.purpose: Defines the styling variants and base classes for the Alert component
variables.usage: Used in the Alert component to apply conditional styling based on the variant prop. Includes base styles for positioning, padding, borders, and special handling for SVG icons

variables.name: Alert
variables.purpose: Main container component for alert messages
variables.usage: Wraps alert content and applies variant-based styling. Accepts all standard HTML div attributes plus a variant prop

variables.name: AlertTitle
variables.purpose: Component for rendering the alert's title/heading
variables.usage: Renders as an h5 element with predefined styling for font weight, line height, and spacing

variables.name: AlertDescription
variables.purpose: Component for rendering the alert's descriptive content
variables.usage: Renders as a div with smaller text size and relaxed line height for paragraphs

key_points: Implements a flexible alert system with three components: Alert, AlertTitle, and AlertDescription
Uses class-variance-authority (cva) for managing style variants
Supports two variants: default and destructive
All components are built using React.forwardRef for proper ref forwarding
Follows a composable pattern where Alert is the container and AlertTitle/AlertDescription are child components

patterns: Component composition pattern with container and child components
ForwardRef pattern for proper ref handling in all components
Utility-first CSS approach with Tailwind classes
Display name assignment for better debugging experience
issues: The AlertTitle renders as h5 but the ref type is HTMLParagraphElement which is inconsistent
The AlertDescription also uses HTMLParagraphElement ref but renders as a div element
No built-in close/dismiss functionality - would need to be implemented by parent component
Limited to two variants (default and destructive) - might need more variants like 'success', 'warning', 'info'
The SVG positioning styles assume an icon will be present, but there's no icon component provided
